intro: Alsine jooi, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to anchor firmly in loose, nutrient-poor substrates. Alsine jooi plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native environment.
